subject: Re: [junit] JavaMail mock?
msgSnippet: ... Dumbster... this is the fake mail system I was thinking of! I think I saw it in an ONJava article or something. -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software
messageBody:
Mike Clark wrote:

>
> On Aug 23, 2004, at 4:52 PM, Timothy N. Jones wrote:
>
> > Is anyone aware of a server-side mock/stub/whatever store and/or
> > transport for JavaMail? I'd like to develop some unit tests for my
> > client-side code that could run even if a mail server was not running.
> > Something like the DSML JNDI provider which I use for LDAP testing
> > would
> > be ideal.
>
> Coincidentally, I just posted a blog on how I tested JavaMail:
>
> http://www.clarkware.com/cgi/blosxom/2004/08/23#DumbsterDiving

Dumbster... this is the fake mail system I was thinking of! I think I
saw it in an ONJava article or something.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
